article.headline: Niagara 109, Canisius 106 (OT)
article.story: BUFFALO, N.Y. (AP) -- Juan Mendez had 37 points and 15 rebounds to rally Niagara to a 109-106 overtime win over Canisius Wednesday night. Mendez scored 17 points in a 11:03 span in the second half to bring Niagara back from a 62-44 deficit to tie it at 86 on a 3-pointer by David Brooks with 3:29 left. The lead changed three times before Mendez tied the game at 96, hitting a layup off a baseline feed from Brooks with 8.1 seconds left. The Purple Eagles stopped Canisius from taking a shot before the end of regulation. Lorenzo Miles provided a spark off the bench for Niagara (3-0) with 11 points, hitting all six free-throw attempts. He went 4-for-4 in overtime and blocked a shot by Jon Ferris with 27 seconds left to tie things at 105. Tremmell Darden gathered the loose ball and made two free throws after Darnell Wilson fouled him with 23.3 seconds left. Toby Foster made his first free throw attempt and missed his second after Niagara received a technical for calling a timeout it did not have with 8.7 seconds left. Miles followed with two free throws to give the Purple Eagles a three-point lead with 7.1 seconds left. Niagara prevented Canisius from attempting a game-tying 3-pointer by fouling Dewitt Doss with four seconds left. After Doss' first foul shot rimmed out, he purposely missed the second shot, but the ball deflected out of bounds on the Golden Griffins (2-3, 0-1) and Niagara killed the clock. Doss scored 23 points, while Foster had 19 points and 10 rebounds.
